meanings.definition: The state or quality of being paltry or insignificant.
meanings.sent1: The paltrinesses of the old toy made it unworthy of keeping.
meanings.sent2: She was disappointed by the paltrinesses of the gift.
meanings.sent3: The paltrinesses of the tiny cupcake made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The paltrinesses of his excuses were as thin as a spider's web.
meanings.sent5: The paltrinesses of the broken pencil were evident in its short length.

meanings.definition: A paltry or insignificant thing or amount.
meanings.sent1: The little girl collected the paltrinesses she found on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: He was unimpressed by the paltrinesses of the coins in his pocket.
meanings.sent3: The paltrinesses of the tiny pebbles in the garden amused the toddler.
meanings.sent4: The paltrinesses of his knowledge were like drops in the ocean of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The paltrinesses of the crumbs on the table were a feast for the ants.
